business.headline: How a change of name caused Bira a loss of Rs 80 crore. Check details Ahead of its IPO, B9 Beverages Private Ltd, the owner of Bira beer, changed its name to B9 Beverages Ltd, causing several compliance hurdles and sales disruptions.

New Income Tax Bill: 10 FAQs you should knowThe current income tax bill which was enacted in 1961, and came into effect in 1962, consisted of 512,535 words and 819 sections. On the contrary, the new bill consists of 259,676 words, 23 chapters and 536 sections.
Sensex, Nifty recover losses to end marginally higher amid volatilityThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 57.65 points to close at 75,996.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.25 points to end at 22,959.50.

Regulatory body warns against rising NPS scams, issues these guidelines The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) has cautioned subscribers of the National Pension Scheme (NPS) and Atal Pension Yojayna (APY) regarding fraudulent calls demanding money to release pension funds.

RBI's latest curbs raise concernConcerns over New India Co-operative Bank's financial stability and a potential Rs 122 crore scam prompted the RBI to take strict action. TCS to issue hike letters soon; salary raise likely between 4-8%: ReportThe annual salary hikes at leading IT firms have gradually reduced over the years. In FY24, TCS employees received an average hike of 7-9%, while in FY22, the hikes were around 10.5%.

What is digital lending? 5 key benefits you should know Digital lending platforms make use of advanced technology, thereby making the loan process faster, simpler and more efficient.

The move comes amid concerns over the bank's financial health and liquidity.

Not Trump's tariffs, but this is what's making stock market investors anxiousThe stock market jitters have occurred despite government measures, including tax relief and the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) decision to reduce the repo rate by 25 basis points.

RBI issues notice to halt all financial operations of New India Co-operative BankRBI's move comes after what it called 'recent material developments' at the bank. New Income Tax bill explained: What's changing and what's notNew Income Tax bill: It aims to simplify the existing Income Tax Act, 1961, by making it more structured and easier to understand. If passed, the new law will come into effect from April 1, 2026.

EPFO likely to maintain 8.25% interest rate on PF deposits EPFO interest rate: In 2024-25, EPFO processed over 50.8 million claims worth Rs 2.05 lakh crore when compared to 44.5 million claims amounting to Rs 1.82 lakh crore settled in the previous year, as per the official data.

Finance Minister Nirmala SItharaman introduces new Income Tax Bill in Lok SabhaFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman tabled the new Income Tax bill in Lok Sabha amid the huge uproar by the opposition MPs. The bill will now be referred to the Select Committee of Lok Sabha for further review.

entertainment.headline: Amortage review: Jisoo's album shakes things up like an 'earthquake'Jisoo's new EP, Amortage, released on February 14, 2025, marks her evolution as a solo artist. The EP blends pop and R&B to explore love's many facets, featuring English tracks and her own songwriting.

Bhabiji writer Manoj Santoshi battles cancer, Shilpa Shinde takes care of himActor Kavita Kaushik made an emotional post on social media, highlighting screenwriter Manoj Santoshi's struggle with liver cancer. She also mentioned actor Shilpa Shinde and thanked her for taking care of him.

The Witch review: Jinyoung, Jeong-eui shine in slow-burning psychological mysteryReleased-Sat Feb 15, 2025The Witch review: The Witch, a new K-drama starring Jinyoung and Jeong-eui, captivates with its psychological mystery and slow-burning narrative. The series, based on a popular webtoon, blends mystery, romance, and suspense, leaving viewers intrigued by the enigmatic characters and their complex interactions, says our review.

Stray Kids' Felix suffers fracture after car accident, misses group's fan meetFelix, a member of the boy band Stray Kids, suffered an arm fracture in a minor car accident, causing him to miss the band's fifth fan meeting.

South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron wanted to make a comeback to films, open a cafeSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, who was found dead in her apartment on Sunday, had wished to make a comeback to the entertainment world, revealed a friend recently.

Gajraj Rao, Renuka Shahane's Dupahiya to bring laughter and chaos to Prime VideoPrime Video's Dupahiya is set in a crime-free village where the first-ever theft of a motorbike creates chaos and drama. Starring Gajraj Rao and Renuka Shahane, the comedy series starts streaming on March 7.

South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, 24, found deadSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, known for her roles in Bloodhounds and The Man from Nowhere, was found dead at her home in Seoul. She was 24. Authorities are investigating the circumstances of her death, with no signs of foul play reported yet.

The White Lotus S3 review: Predictable? Yes. Addictive? Also, yesReleased-Mon Feb 17, 2025The White Lotus Season 3 review: The White Lotus returns with a new season set in Thailand, offering a fresh cultural backdrop while retaining its biting satire on the ultra-rich. Kanye West says he fought 5 hours for Grammy tickets amid guest list confusionRapper Kanye West, in a post on X, revealed that he fought for five hours to secure Grammy tickets amid guest list chaos. This comes amid claims that Kanye arrived at the event uninvited.

Comedian Anubhav Bassi's Lucknow show cancelled after warning over foul languageThe shows of comedian Anubhav Singh Bassi in Lucknow were cancelled due to concerns over inappropriate content, following a complaint by the UP Women's Commission vice-chairperson. Watch: Ed Sheeran pauses Delhi concert as fan faints, wears Team India jerseyEd Sheeran wrapped up his India tour in Gurugram on February 15. He paused his concert briefly to help a fan who fainted.

Starring Yami Gautam and Pratik Gandhi, the movie delivers a thrilling and entertaining experience perfect for a cosy night in.

Scared of Loving You: Selena Gomez's new song for her Valentine Benny Blanco out Lovebirds Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco have now collaborated for a new album titled I Said I Love You First. These characters, crafted by female screenwriters, challenge traditional portrayals. This Valentine's Day we analyse if they are too good to be true.
Prime Video's Rings of Power renewed for third seasonPrime Video's Rings of Power has been renewed for the third installment, the makers announced recently. Its second season was released last year.

Kanye West, Bianca Censori heading for divorce? Team clarifiesIt was previously reported that singer-rapper Kanye West and his wife, Bianca Censori, had split and were headed for divorce. However, a recent development has refuted these claims, labelling them as "tabloid rumours."

Sanya Malhotra's Mrs. makes questions on marital rape, mechanical sex personalImagine a woman bleeding for five days in a month, and those five days being the most peaceful in her life because she can finally refuse sex to her husband. He can't assert his power over her. That's how Sanya Malhotra's 'Mrs.' unsettles you and makes you think.

Singer-composer Vishal Dadlani meets with an accident, undergoes treatmentVishal Dadlani of the Vishal-Sheykhar duo is undergoing treatment after an accident, leading to the postponement of their upcoming concert scheduled for March 2.

Rozlyn Khan sues Ankita Lokhande for defamation over 'cheap' remark TV actor Rozlyn Khan took legal action against Ankita Lokhande's recent comments. Ankita had called her 'cheap', for her claims about Hina Khan's cancer battle.

general news.headline: Champions Trophy: Pakistan clarify Indian flag controversy after backlashThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has issued a clarification after India flag wasn't hoisted along with other nations on the the roof of the National Stadium in Karachi ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Disease is not a joke, what's a stand-up comic got to do with it?Diseases are to be discussed at a symposium sponsored by big pharmaceutical companies where doctors fly in on tickets paid for by the big pharmaceutical companies. Is that Kashmiri comic a doctor, a pharmacist, or a journalist?

Nepal BTech student's death by suicide in Bhubaneswar college sparks big protestHundreds of students gathered on campus, chanting "we want justice", and accused the university administration of downplaying the alleged suicide case.

Five red flags Railways missed just ahead of New Delhi stampedeThe stampede at New Delhi Railway Station on Saturday claimed 18 lives. The tragedy, which occurred hours after signs of overcrowding at the station, worsened due to confusing announcements, inadequate personnel, and delays in several eastbound trains on a few platforms on the Ajmeri Gate side. These were the five red flags, if noticed and acted upon, could have saved precious lives.

Silent and sinister: How Akshaye Khanna's Aurangzeb stole ChhaavaAkshaye Khanna delivers a chilling, restrained portrayal of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb in Chhaava, standing out amid past cinematic depictions. His silent menace contrasts Vicky Kaushal's fiery energy, proving that true power doesn't always need words—just presence.

Congress distances from Sam Pitroda's China remark: Definitely not party's viewThe Congress distanced itself from Sam Pitroda's remarks on China, stating they do not reflect the party's views. Pitroda questioned the perceived Chinese threat, calling it exaggerated. Congress reaffirmed concerns over China's security and economic challenges.

Rahul Gandhi slammed for flying banned Chinese drone: 'Rules don't apply to him?' In a video posted on X, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi showcased a Chinese DJI drone which has been banned in India since 2022. He also acknowledged that "unfortunately, they don't allow to fly these in Lutyens Delhi".
A taste of their own medicine: Reciprocal tariffs will hurt US healthcare and howAbout 47 per cent of all generic prescriptions filed in the US were supplied by Indian companies in 2022.

Why Elon Musk takes 4-year-old son to every meeting.  Xtension or X-factor?Be it a meeting with PM Modi or a visit to the Oval Office, Elon Musk's son X seems to be part of his retinue. Why does Musk take the 4-year-old to meetings? This might have to do with Musk's lonely childhood, his strategy to carve a more acceptable image or the projection of an extension.

In farewell speech, poll body chief flags 'misleading narratives' during electionsOutgoing Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar, in his farewell speech, alleged that the poll body is "unfairly blamed" by those "unwilling to accept electoral outcomes" and is perceived as a "convenient scapegoat".

'Life-threatening cold' warning as many US states brace for severe polar vortex A polar vortex is bringing life-threatening cold to the Rockies and northern Plains after winter storms battered the eastern US, killing at least 10 people. Kentucky saw severe flooding, with nine deaths, while snow and ice caused road chaos in the Midwest.

FIR against Ranveer Allahbadia, Samay Raina, others in Jaipur over obscene remarksA third FIR has been filed against YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia and others over remarks made on the show India's Got Latent. The Jai Rajputana Sangh in Jaipur lodged a case, and the investigation is being conducted by Khar police.

Turban thrown in dustbin, tortured in US detention camp: Deportee recounts horrorA 23-year-old man who was deported from the US to Amritsar along with 111 others on Sunday alleged he faced torture in a detention camp when he was caught entering the US illegally. He claimed he was in shackles on the deportation flight.

Despite India opting to play in Dubai, excitement is high, with Pakistan hoping to host a successful tournament.

There is a limit to petitions: Top court defers pleas on Places of Worship Act Earlier, the Supreme Court expressed its displeasure over the filing of several fresh pleas in a case related to the validity of the Places of Worship Act, which mandates the religious character of a place to be maintained as it existed on August 15, 1947.

US site drops Taiwan independence reference, China urges it to 'correct mistakes'China urged the US to "correct its mistakes" after the State Department removed wording opposing Taiwan independence. Beijing called it a provocative move, while Taiwan welcomed US support.
Electric cars vs hybrids: What will buyers opt for in 2025?Although the BEV segment is growing in India, the pace has been slow. The hybrid segment has been even slower.

New crowd control plan after Delhi stampede: Focus on 60 stations, use of AIDays after a stampede killed 18 people at the New Delhi railway station, the Centre has introduced a new crowd control plan, including the creation of permanent holding zones at 60 high-traffic stations, sources told India Today TV.

After Revanth Reddy's caste jibe at Modi, BJP questions Rahul Gandhi's lineageBJP and Congress are locked in a caste-politics battle in Telangana after Chief Minister Revanth Reddy claimed Prime Minister Modi was a 'legally converted Backward Class.' BJP leader Bandi Sanjay hit back, questioning Rahul Gandhi's caste, alleging Rajiv Gandhi was a Parsi.

Where will Delhi's new Chief Minister take oath? Possible venuesDelhi's new chief minister oath-taking ceremony will most likely take place on February 20, with Ramlila Maidan, Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium, and the Yamuna riverfront as potential venues.

No money, Pandya brothers said they had Maggi for 3 years: Nita Ambani on MI findIPL 2025: Mumbai Indians owner Nita Ambani revealed how the franchise were able to land the Pandya brothers and Jasprit Bumrah and make them a vital part of the Indian cricket team. Bumrah and the Pandya brothers won multiple titles with MI.

Virat Kohli eyes Universe Boss Chris Gayle's historic record Champions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli has the chance of becoming the leading run-scorer in the tournament, going past the legendary Chris Gayle, who scored 791 runs from 17 matches.

My PR is my cricket: Ajinkya Rahane targets return to Indian Test teamRanji Trophy 2024-25: Ajinkya Rahane is aiming for a comeback into the Indian Test team as he feels there is cricket left in him. Rahane last played for India in Tests during the West Indies tour in 2023.

Not dissimilar to Jasprit Bumrah: Ex-captain defends Aussie spinner's bowling actionFormer Australia captain Tim Paine jumped to the defence of Matt Kuhnemann, claiming that the spinner has a similar action to that of Jasprit Bumrah. Kuhnemann was reported for suspect action after the Sri Lanka Test series.

When Shakib Al Hasan, Mahmudullah's heroics shocked New ZealandChampions Trophy: Back in 2017, Bangladesh recorded a famous win against New Zealand after Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah's heroic 224-run partnership at the Sophia Gardens in Cardiff. Shakib and Mahmudullah's twin centuries helped the Tigers chase down 266 with 16 balls to spare.

India to win Champions Trophy, Rohit Sharma highest run-getter: Michael ClarkeChampions Trophy 2025: Former Australia captain Michael Clarke feels that Rohit Sharma will be the highest run-getter in this year's Champions Trophy. Clarke also feels India will win the tournament once again with Rohit leading from the front.

Indians should be allowed to play overseas leagues only after retiring: KarthikFormer Indian wicketkeeper Dinesh Karthik said that the IPL is the 'crown jewel' of Indian cricket and the BCCI was right to bar its men's cricketers from taking part in overseas T20 leagues.

Champions Trophy Classics: When tail wagged to help West Indies script historyThe final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2004 played between the West Indies and England at the Oval is still counted amongst the greatest final of an ICC event, thanks to a game-changing batting heroics of Ian Bradshaw and Courtney Browne. Relive the classic game in our special feature ahead of the upcoming edition of the tournament.

James Maddison earns Tottenham 1-0 victory over Manchester UnitedTottenham Hotspur midfielder James Maddison starred with an early goal against Manchester United which helped his team register a 1-0 victory in the Premier League on Sunday, February 16.

Champions Trophy 2025: India to play on fresh pitches in Dubai The Indian cricket team is set to play their matches of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 on two fresh pitches in Dubai specially kept aside for the tournament.

WPL 2025: Priya Mishra, Gardner guide Gujarat to 1st win of season vs UP WarriorzGujarat Giants registered their first win of the season as they beat UP Warriorz in the third match of the Women's Premier League 2025. Ashleigh Gardner was once again top scorer for Gujarat.

Carlos Alcaraz reacts to Jannik Sinner's doping settlement, eyes No. 1 spotWhile Jannik Sinner's agreement with the World Anti-Doping Agency for a reduced doping ban has created a stir in the tennis community, Carlos Alcaraz seemed uninterested in the debate surrounding his arch-rival.

Shami's workout, Pant's injury scare: India's 1st training highlights in DubaiThe Indian cricket team took part in their first practice session after landing in Dubai for the Champions Trophy 2025 as Mohammed Shami was seen working along with bowling coach Morne Morkel. Rishabh Pant was hit by a shot from Hardik Pandya but recovered quickly after being attended by the team's physio.

CSK vs MI double returns after a year, no Hardik Pandya in 1st matchIPL 2025: Chennai Super Kings and Mumbai Indians will face twice in the IPL season for the first time since 2023. Hardik Pandya, Mumbai Indians' captain, will miss their first meeting in Chennai on March 23.

Sure MS Dhoni will overtake me in T20s, not fascinated by records: Dinesh KarthikDinesh Karthik recently surpassed MS Dhoni on the list of batters with the most runs in T20s. The wicketkeeper-batter reflected on his memorable SA20 stint, describing his experience of rubbing shoulders with Joe Root at Paarl Royals as fantastic.

IPL 2025 team-wise full schedule: Key matches of CSK, MI, RCB, KKR and othersThe schedule for the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) was unveiled by the BCCI (Board of Control for Cricket in India) on Sunday, February 16. Here's the team-wise schedule of all the IPL teams such as CSK, MI, RCB and KKR amongst others.

IPL 2025 schedule announced: 13 venues, 12 double-headers in new seasonA total of 13 venues will be used for the new season of the IPL in 2025 as the tournament starts on March 22. The 2025 season will see 12 double headers take place as the 10 teams battle it out for the title.

Watch: India suffer injury scare as Pant gets hit on his knee during practiceIndia wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant was seen in excruciating pain after being hit on his knee during the team's first practice session in Dubai.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
